subject: Sexual Health
title: You Cannot Get Pregnant During Your Period Myth
description: A micro-lesson that makes You Cannot Get Pregnant During Your Period Myth usable.

hook.text: Many people believe menstruation is a safe time for unprotected sex. It is not that simple.

buildup.text: In a typical 28-day cycle, ovulation occurs around day 14. Sex during the period seems safely far away.

discovery.text: But cycles vary. Women with shorter cycles may ovulate soon after their period ends.

twist.text: Sperm can survive up to 5 days inside the body. Sex on the last day of a period could lead to conception.

climax.text: No day of the cycle is guaranteed safe without contraception. Biology is less predictable than calendars suggest.

punchline.text: Periods are not a free pass. Sperm can wait five days.

quiz.question: Why can pregnancy occur from sex during a period?
options: Sperm survive days and ovulation timing varies
